job_title: Server/Waiter in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Friendly, welcoming, supportive, family environment
cons: Some times can be understaffed.

job_title: Life Enrichment Coordinator in Mount Healthy, OH
pros: Fun and relaxing work environment
cons: Low pay and unpredictable work days

job_title: STNA/CNA in Cincinnati, OH
pros:
-great employees
Employee incentives 
Free lunch 
Shift diff
Easy work pace
cons:
Low pay rate
Too many staff call offs

review_title: Not a good place to work
job_title: STNA/CNA in Mason, OH
pros: There were no pros working at this place
cons: Favoritism, if you needed to leave work early for a family emergency they said that you can’t leave unless it’s a really bad family emergency, pay sucks, employees and management are rude as all get out

job_title: State Tested Nursing Assistant (STNA) in Mason, OH
pros: Very nice clean facilities, good salary
cons: Floating a lot even when requested to not, does not require vaccines for staff

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Mason, OH
pros: Great staff. Great environment. Great residents. Great job when fully staffed.
cons: Staffing is horrible. Staffing is rough everywhere but its making it a very taxing job.

job_title: Administrative in Mason, OH
pros: The company is pretty good at making you feel appreciated. The benefits - time off and health insurance is really good.
cons: Communication can be an issue some times. But not sure where you work that its not a problem.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Waynesville, IL
pros: great staff, wofderful residents, great building
cons: Management, not enough help, not enough supplies

job_title: Food Service Worker in Mason, OH
pros: Many of the residents are very kind and easy to get along with. Also, a lot of the lower level employees make the job as fun as they can.
cons: The leadership is toxic beyond belief. Not to mention how many racist, sexist, and homophobic remarks get swept under the table. It's an HR nightmare.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Mason, OH
pros:
We get lots of supervisor support 
STNAs work hard
cons: Not close to I-75 have to commute

job_title: STNA in Mason, OH
pros: This company actually follows state guidelines. Very safe place for residents to live, they are well taken care of. In that aspect one of the best places I worked.
cons:
Mainly management/staff goes behind your back and talks bad about you (very immature/unprofessional) witnessed it multiple times. 
Management just sucks, they "favorite" people so they can get away with things. Some recieve special treatment because they're the managements best buddy. 
So sadly if you're not shoved up the managements butt, you dont get the benefits of getting away with things like some of your co-workers do. 

Dont expect them to listen to you either, they dont really care enough about their employees to stay there. There are plenty of jobs out there that will care/listen more and that's the kind of treatment everyone deserves with their job.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Cincinnati, OH
pros: Kind, friendly residents liked me.
cons: Non existent uncaring poor management

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Mason, OH
pros: Very clean facility and organized
cons: Not diverse in management or residents
